title: Grand Theft Auto San Andreas (GTA SA) - OST [FLAC] by ConCQWZ
description:
Here is the [b]totally complete and lossless[/b] soundtrack of Grand Theft Auto 3 : San Andreas.

GTA SA's soundtrack is quite complex and different from the other GTAs : "Whereas Vice City used a single massive audio track per radio station, San Andreas splits each station into about 150 audio clips, which are strung together randomly according to some rules. The audio clips are things like:
- Station idents
- Announcements about in-game events (e.g. weather, travel)
- General chatter
- Phone-ins
- Commercials
- Programming (mostly songs)
Commercials are not included with the main radio stations, but in a seperate file."

So by "totally complete", I mean that I converted each .pak file into (in most cases) 3 .flac tracks, that go as follow :
- a .flac track for all the tracks, [i]without intros nor outros[/i]
- a .flac track for all the tracks, [i]with intros and outros[/i]
- a .flac track for every host's intervention, that includes (in order) : intervention on any subject ; intervention about the time of the day ; phone calls ; weather reports ; station idents ; GTA world events.
[b]Each track has a .cue sheet[/b], so that you can play the songs and the talks together, choose to have the intros/outros or not, or split the tracks up to your preferences. Each radio station comes tagged and has a folder picture.

Details :
- I also added the adverts tracks, .flac + .cue + tagged.
- SF-UR is the only station not to have clean song files, so there's only a intros/outros track.
- WCTR is split up in 3 tracks, "Interventions" (only idents, in fact), The News and the Programs.
- A few songs don't have any intro or outro.
- Most songs have 2 maybe 3 intro and/or outro, but I thought it would be useless to upload 21GB of the same soundtrack just for a few intros.

[b]Please note that my Internet upload speed is not that fast, so be patient, firsts downloaders![/b]

I hope you'll enjoy! I'll be seeding for a long time.


I advise you to use foobar2000's AutoPlaylist feature to melt those soundtracks and interventions to your own playlists.
